content:
Transform3D Class

Definition

Provides a parent class for all three-dimensional transformations, including translation, rotation, and scale transformations.

In this Article

[System.Windows.Localizability(System.Windows.LocalizationCategory.None, Readability=System.Windows.Readability.Unreadable)]
public abstract class Transform3D : System.Windows.Media.Media3D.GeneralTransform3D

Remarks

Use the MatrixTransform3D class to create transformations not available from the RotateTransform3D, TranslateTransform3D, and ScaleTransform3D classes.

Properties

Identity

Gets the identity transformation.

public static System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Transform3D Identity { get; }
Value
Transform3D

Identity transformation.

Remarks

The identity transformation has the effect of multiplying the object by the identity matrix.

Inverse

Gets the inverse transformation of this object, if possible.

public override System.Windows.Media.Media3D.GeneralTransform3D Inverse { get; }
Value
System.Windows.Media.Media3D.GeneralTransform3D

An inverse of this instance, if possible; otherwise, null.

Remarks

Inverse is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. For more information, see Versions and Dependencies.

IsAffine

Gets a value that specifies whether the matrix is affine.

public abstract bool IsAffine { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the matrix is affine; otherwise, false.

Remarks

An affine transformation preserves collinearity.

Value

Gets the Matrix3D that represents the value of the current transformation.

public abstract System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Matrix3D Value { get; }
Value
Matrix3D

Matrix3D that represents the value of the current transformation.

Methods

Clone()

Creates a modifiable clone of this Transform3D, making deep copies of this object's values.

public System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Transform3D Clone ();
Returns
Transform3D

A modifiable clone of the current object. The cloned object's stem.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen* property is false even if the source's stem.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen* property is true.

Remarks

This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen Freezable objects (or any Freezable object). For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.

For more information, see Clone.

When copying dependency properties, this method copies resource references and data bindings (they might no longer resolve) but not animations or their current values.

CloneCurrentValue()

Creates a modifiable clone of this Transform3D object, making deep copies of this object's current values. Resource references, data bindings, and animations are not copied, but their current values are.

public System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Transform3D CloneCurrentValue ();
Returns
Transform3D

A modifiable clone of the current object. The cloned object's stem.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen* property is false even if the source's stem.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen* property is true.

Remarks

This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen Freezable objects (or any Freezable object). For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.

For more information, see CloneCurrentValue.

Transforms the specified Point3D.

public System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D Transform (System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D point);

Point3D

Point3D to transform.

Returns
Point3D

Transformed Point3D.

Transforms the specified array of Point3D objects.

public void Transform (System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D[] points);
points
Point3D[]

Array of Point3D objects to transform.

Transforms the specified Point4D.

public System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D Transform (System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D point);

Point4D to transform.

Returns

Transformed Point4D.

Transforms the specified array of Point4D objects.

public void Transform (System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point4D[] points);
points
Point4D[]

Array of Point4D objects to transform.

Transform(Vector3D)

Transforms the specified Vector3D.

public System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Vector3D Transform (System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Vector3D vector);
vector
Vector3D

Vector3D to transform.

Returns
Vector3D

Transformed Vector3D.

Transform(Vector3D[])

Transforms the specified array of Vector3D objects.

public void Transform (System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Vector3D[] vectors);
vectors
Vector3D[]

Array of Vector3D objects to transform.

TransformBounds(Rect3D)

Transforms the specified 3-D bounding box and returns an axis-aligned 3-D bounding box that is exactly large enough to contain it.

public override System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D TransformBounds (System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D rect);
rect
Rect3D

The 3-D bounding box to transform.

Returns
Rect3D

The smallest axis-aligned 3-D bounding box possible that contains the transformed rect.

Remarks

TransformBounds is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. For more information, see Versions and Dependencies.

TryTransform(Point3D,Point3D)

Attempts to transform the specified 3-D point and returns a value that indicates whether the transformation was successful.

public override bool TryTransform (System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D inPoint, out System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Point3D result);
inPoint
Point3D

The 3-D point to transform.

result
Point3D

The result of transforming inPoint.

Returns
Boolean

true if inPoint was transformed; otherwise, false.

Remarks

Unlike the Transform method, this method does not throw an exception if the transformation is unsuccessful.

TryTransform is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5. For more information, see Versions and Dependencies.
